data.title: Liechtenstein Royal Family
data.meta_description: Monarchies of Europe including Queen Victoria's Descendants
data.text:
REFERENCE TITLE NAME BORN DIED TITLE NAME BORN DIED COMMENTS 41 Prince Alfred Aloys of Liechtenstein 1842 1907 Princess Henriette of Liechtenstein 1843 1931 The Liechtenstein ruling house is an old Austrian family in which Liechtenstein was originally a castle near Vienna, Austria. The Lordship of Schellenburg and the County of Vaduz were bought in 1699 and 1712 respectively by Prince Johannes Adam of Liechtenstein who died in 1712. All his possessions were inherited by his cousin Anton Florian of Liechtenstein and in 1719 The Holy Emperor Charles VI decreed that the Lordship of Schellenberg and the County of Vaduz be raised to the dignity of principality within the Holy Roman Empire with the name Liechtenstein. Liechtenstein became independent in 1866.

Alfred Aloys and Henriette were first cousins, their respective fathers Prince Franz de Paula (1802-1887) and Prince Alois II (11 th Furst von und zu Liechtenstein) (1796- 1858) were brothers.

Genealogical tree (Wikipedia verison) may be of some interest. 41.1 Princess Franziska Maria of Liechtenstein 1866 1939 41.2 Prince Franz of Liechtenstein 1868 1929 41.3 Prince Alois of Liechtenstein 1869 1955 Archduchess Elizabeth of Austria 1878 1960 See 19.J36 - Prince Alois renounced his rights to the Princely House of Liechtenstein on 26 February 1923 in favour of his son Franz Joseph. Archduchess Elizabeth's jewellery went missing 41.31 Prince Franz Joseph II of Liechtenstein (14 th Prince) 1906 1989 Countess Georgine von Wilczek 1921 1989 Franz Joseph II succeeded his childless great uncle (and distant cousin) Franz I (1853-1938) (13 th Furst von und zu Liechtenstein) as Furst of Liechtenstein. Franz I renounced his throne in favour of Prince Franz Joseph on 31 March 1938 and died shortly afterwards on 25 July.

Franz I was a brother of Franz Joseph's grandmother Henriette of Liechtenstein

An interesting account of the secret wedding of Franz I to Elisabeth von Gutmann (1875-1947).

A brief report on the death of Franz Joseph II.

An interesting account of "WHY THE NAZIS LEFT THE STATE OF LIECHTENSTEIN ALONE".

Prince Franz Joseph II handed over political/executive power to his son Hans Adam II on 26 August 1984 although he still retained his position as The Prince of Liechtenstein. 41.311 Prince Hans-Adam II of Liechtenstein (15 th Prince) 1945 Countess Marie Kinsky von Wchinitz and Tettau 1940 2021 Although Prince Hans Adam II handed over political/executive power to his son Alois on 15 August 2004 he still retains his position as The Prince of Liechtenstein. 41.3111 Hereditary Prince Alois of Liechtenstein 1968 Princess Sophie of Bavaria (and Duchess in Bavaria) 1967 See 18.1511341 - Although Prince Hans Adam II handed over political/executive power to his son Alois on 15 August 2004 he still retains his position as The Prince of Liechtenstein.

A right "Royal Bash" to celebrate the wedding of Prince Alois and Princess Sophie. 41.31111 Prince Joseph Wenzel of Liechtenstein 1995 41.31112 Princess Marie-Caroline of Liechtenstein 1996 41.31113 Prince Georg Antonius of Liechtenstein 1999 41.31114 Prince Nikolaus Sebastian of Liechtenstein 2000 41.3112 Prince Maximilian Nikolaus of Liechtenstein 1969 Angela Brown 1958 41.31121 Prince Alfons Constantin of Liechtenstein 2001 41.3113 Prince Constantin Ferdinand of Liechtenstein 1972 2023 Countess Maria Kálnoky de Köröspatak 1975 Maria is a sister of Countess Ilona Kálnoky de Köröspatak (wife of Prince Ferdinand of Hohenzollern) 41.31131 Prince Moritz Emanuel of Liechtenstein 2003 41.31132 Princess Georgina Maximiliana of Liechtenstein 2005 41.31133 Princess Benedikt Ferdinand of Liechtenstein 2008 41.3114 Princess Tatjana Nora of Liechtenstein 1973 Philipp von Lattorff 1968 41.312 Prince Philipp Erasmus of Liechtenstein 1946 Isabelle de l'Arbe de Malander 1949 41.3121 Prince Alexander of Liechtenstein 1972 Astrid Kohl 1968 41.31211 Princess Theodora Alexandra of Liechtenstein 2004 41.3122 Prince Wenzeslaus of Liechtenstein 1974 41.3123 Prince Rudolf Ferdinand of Liechtenstein 1975 Tilsin Tanberk 1974 41.31231 Princess Alienor of Liechtenstein 2014 2015 The sad circumstance on the death of Princess Alienor 41.31232 Princess Laetitia of Liechtenstein 2016 Laetitia and Karl Ludwig are twins 41.31233 Prince Karl Ludwig of Liechtenstein 2016 Laetitia and Karl Ludwig are twins 41.313 Prince Nikolaus of Liechtenstein 1947 Princess Margaretha of Luxemburg 1957 See 34.2214 41.3131 Prince Leopold of Liechtenstein 1984 1984 41.3132 Princess Maria Anunciata of Liechtenstein 1985 Emanuele Musini ? Count Alfred zu Erbach-Fürstenau (1813-1874) son Raimond (1868-1926) was the father of Eugen, another son Adalbert (1861-1944) was a grandfather of Elisabeth. 41.344 Prince Christoph Alois of Liechtenstein 1958 41.345 Princess Marie Helene of Liechtenstein 1960 41.346 Princess Georgina Maria of Liechtenstein 1962 Count Clemens von Waldburg zu Zeil und Trauchburg 1960 41.347 Princess Michaela Maria of Liechtenstein 1969 Alexander Heuken 1977 As an aside Michaela and Alexander produced a film "Do you remember me?" prior to their marriage 41.35 Prince Ulrich of Liechtenstein 1913 1978 41.36 Princess Marie Henriette of Liechtenstein 1914 2011 Count Peter von Eltz genannt Faust von Stromberg 1909 1992 41.37 Prince Alois of Liechtenstein 1917 1967 41.38 Prince Heinrich of Liechtenstein 1920 1993 Countess Amalie "Ali" Podstatsky-Lichtenstein 1935 41.381 Princess Maria Elisabeth of Liechtenstein 1969 Gilles Rouvinez 1964 41.382 Prince Hubertus Alois of Liechtenstein 1971 Claudia Rüegg 1974 41.383 Princess Marie Therese of Liechtenstein 1974 41.4 Princess Maria Theresia of Liechtenstein 1871 1964 41.5 Prince Johannes of Liechtenstein 1873 1959 Countess Marie Andrássy von Czik-Szent-Király u.Krasna-Horka 1886 1961 41.51 Prince Alfred Géza of Liechtenstein 1907 1991 Princess Ludmila von Lobkowicz 1908 1974 41.511 Princess Maria Christina of Liechtenstein 1933 2009 Marquis Roland de Roys de Lédignan Saint Michel 1934 2017 Roland's father René Marquis de Roys de Lédignan Saint-Michel was arrested by the Gestapo, deported, tortured and died in deportation to the Ellrich camp in 1945 further details.
